fields.summary: browser is not notifying me if I try to move focus away from a page or tab that has unsaved changes

comments.body: [~jloza] It'd be much helpful if you could provide more details on this issue.

hi [~kyolee], On the page at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Single+instance+view+-+refreshed which is the sample template for any resource detail page, there's info over in the notes section about what should be happening. 

[~kgill] says the browser should be handling this, but it's not. So, we need to do something to force this to trigger in the browser or just do it ourselves. I think [~kgill] might have ideas about how to handle this one, you may want to talk to him about it. 

Thanks!
not sure the browser will do this without assistance.. see https://github.com/codedance/jquery.AreYouSure
Current branch GUI-795-adjust contains a partial fix for this issue.
hi [~kyolee] if this ticket is in progress it should be moved to In Progress here please. Thanks!

Pull request has been created for UX review:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/770

Tested on Chrome and Safari on OS X. The fix here does not work for Firefox since Firefox has removed the 'beforeunload' message feature:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=588292
UX Review pending. See the comment above.

Is there one test page I am supposed to be looking at? I added a tag on the image detail page but did not save changes, then clicked instances in the nav menu and was not notified of my unsaved changes, it just went to the other page. (Chrome)

Stopped reviewing at that point since I am not sure what I am supposed to be checking.
[~kyolee], [~jloza], Per our IRC conversation today, we have decided to punt this to 4.1

[~kyolee] When you have the chance to work on this for 4.1, we'll need to use window.onunload rather than beforeunload.  
See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window.onunload
It appears that the fix for Safari ended up disabling the feature on Chrome. Will need to look into the issue later as well as the behavior of 'onunload'.
Is this ticket still targeted for 4.1 release?
[~kyolee] yep.

Pull request for UX review is ready at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/844

The feature has been implemented on the image, instance, scaling group, volume, snapshot and security group detail pages, and those pages are ready for UX review.

The behaviors include:
   When there exists input on the tag editor, which has been added, the page will display a warning message if user tries to click away from the page or click the submit button.
   When there exist unsaved changes on the detail page, such as name or tag update, the page will display a warning message if user tries to click away from the page.

The feature has been tested on Chrome, Firefox, and Safari on OS X. One noticeable issue is that Firefox wouldn't display the specified warning message, rather only display the genetic, default message.

One area to focus on for this UX review is the handling of the dialog interactions when there exist unsaved changes. For instance, type some values into the tag editor without adding, and try to attach the volume. You will notice strange error case, which is left untreated since it requires UX input.

A few comments:

* unsaved changes notice should pop up if the user tries to change tabs on a detail page, which may resolve whatever issue you were seeing with unsaved tags and then attaching volumes
* I am not seeing anything happen at all in your GUI-997 branch. I typed in the name field on the instance detail page and clicked away from it in various ways and am not seeing any notice whatsoever.

[~jloza] Sorry about the confusion. The branch is GUI-997-new, not GUI-997.

And, the unsaved changes notice will pop up if the tabs are clicked on the detail page. Try the dialogs instead, which lead to more complicated UX issues.

Thank you!

Kyo
[~kyolee]: Pull request 844 needs work, especially w.r.t. i18n issues
[~kgill] will take care of i18n and the JS format issues after the UX review.
[~kyolee] if this is ready for UX review please move This ticket to In Review and assign to me. Thanks.

Pull request for UX review:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/844

* modal should not display when user clicks cancel. 
* i changed some atuff and deleted the changes and am still getting the notice if I try and change page (added letter to instance description on instance detail page and then deleted letter)
* log out option still worked even though I had unsaved changes
* can we customize the message displayed or it is controlled by the browser? The current message in chrome lacks clarity IMO.

I am not sure what you meant in your comment "One area to focus on for this UX review is the handling of the dialog interactions when there exist unsaved changes. For instance, type some values into the tag editor without adding, and try to attach the volume. You will notice strange error case, which is left untreated since it requires UX input." I had unsaved changes on the instance detail page and tried to change to the volumes tab to attach a volume and got the expected message.
[~jloza] Try to open up the dialogs on the volume detail page while having some unsaved changes to see the interactions.

[~jloza]

modal should not display when user clicks cancel.

-> Will update the branch so that the warning message will not be displayed in case of clicking the cancel button,

i changed some atuff and deleted the changes and am still getting the notice if I try and change page (added letter to instance description on instance detail page and then deleted letter)

-> Currently there is no way of knowing whether the user has reverted changes; the warning message and the submit enable/disable button react to the same flag that can only detect whether the user has initiated changes in the input box.

log out option still worked even though I had unsaved changes

-> The branch will be updated to detect the log out option.

can we customize the message displayed or it is controlled by the browser? The current message in chrome lacks clarity IMO.

-> The warning messages can be customized for Chrome and Safari only. The messages are included in the detail page template files.
See the comments above.
[~jloza]: Could you test this in Firefox as well?  Looking at the code, we don't appear to be handling the notifications well on Firefox.

Firefox will not display customized warning messages; it only shows Firefox's default unload warning message. It appears that they dropped that option for security reason. Besides this default warning message issue, Firefox should be handling the unsaved changes the same way as other browsers, Chrome and Safari.

[~kyolee] in some places you display the message if the user tries to initiate an action from the detail page, in others you don't. We should be consistent and always display the message if there are unsaved changes. 

The flag doesn't go away if nothing is changed (i add and then remove a letter for example? [~kgill] is there a better way to implement this so we can detect this?

Will check on FF later.
[~kgill] I saw the notice on FF when changing tabs or clicking away via breadcrumbs or the nav bar, where specifically are you concerned?
[~jloza]: I was concerned about the lack of custom message support in Firefox, but that appears to be a known issue based on the comments here.
[~jloza]: Adding and removing a letter is detected as a change in the browser, and there's no way around that I'm afraid.
ah OK, I see [~kgill], thank you! Yeah, the lack of custom message support is suboptimal but the default message provided by FF is better than nothing, for sure, so I am willing to live with it. :)

[~jloza] In your comment "in some places you display the message if the user tries to initiate an action from the detail page, in others you don't.", please provide more information on the cases above. The code that displays the warning messages are the same for all detail pages, thus the behavior should be identical.

[~jloza] and, please check out the case on the volume detail page where some changes have been made, and without saving them, try to attach the volume to an instance. In which case, the page would trigger the warning message, yet ignore the submit button, thus getting stuck in a strange state.

We will need to decide on how to handle such case where the dialog actions should ignore the existing changes and proceed with the dialog action, or disable the actions unless the changes are saved, which makes the interaction confusing since it's not clear when the right time to display the warning message.
[~kyolee] that is specifically for items in the more actions menu. Some items trigger the message when you choose them, some do not.

[~jloza] So, would you like the warning message to be displayed, or not displayed? If displayed, would you like it to be displayed at the time of the dialog opens, or at the time of the submit button is clicked? If not displayed, then the changes will be ignore upon the submit of the dialog action.
Message should be displayed before the dialog opens.

Pull request is ready for UX review at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/844

Added features:

For image, instance, scaling group, security group, volume and snapshot pages.

    Do not display the warning message when the cancel link is clicked.
    Display the warning message when user tries to log out.
    Display the warning message modal instead when user tries to open up a dialog while there exist unsaved changes.

For dialog text when they have unsaved changes, please use:

"Confirm navigation

You must click the "Save Changes" button before you leave this page or your changes will be lost.

Are you sure you want to leave this page?"

The button text is fine.

Please use that text whether changing tabs or breadcrumbs or nav or the actions menu. Those should look exactly the same,a nd currently do not. Also, when I clicked the actions menu, I saw the modal for the requested action first, then it left and I saw your save changes modal. You should just pop up exactly the same dialog in both cases without seeing anything else first. 

When they haven't added tags, there was already code in place to handle that, why would that have changed? Just warn them of saving changes here, and then if they click save changes and there are unadded accounts or rules or users or tags or whatever that notice should be triggered. Those are two distinct cases, don't try and merge the messages together please.

[~jloza] The message,

"Confirm navigation
You must click the "Save Changes" button before you leave this page or your changes will be lost.
Are you sure you want to leave this page?"

can only be used for the case 2 where the user wants to click on the links to navigate away from the page without saving.

In case 3, where the modal is displayed, the user is not leaving the page, rather it's the case where the user has opened the dialog on the page, in which case the warning modal will be displayed. So, in this case, the sentence, "Are you sure you want to leave this page?" wouldn't make sense since the user is not intending on leaving the page.

And, in your comment, " I saw the modal for the requested action first, then it left and I saw your save changes modal. You should just pop up exactly the same dialog in both cases without seeing anything else first.", currently it's difficult to have the warning modal to show up since Foundation will not cancel the opening of a modal once it's initiated. For this reason, we need to close the opening modal, then show the warning after.

Also in your comment, "When they haven't added tags, there was already code in place to handle that, why would that have changed?... Those are two distinct cases, don't try and merge the messages together please.", it's not clear what you meant here. The code that handles the unsaved tag warning hasn't been changed 
at all. The case you are talking about is when the user tried to save the changes without having the tags added via the tag editor, in which case, the warning message, You must click the "Add Tag" button before you submit this for your tag to be included." will be displayed. However, as mentioned before, the same message cannot be used since when the user is navigating away from the page, the phrase "click the "Add Tag" button before you submit this" doesn't make, which was why I was requesting the new warning message for this case.

The case 1 is the case when there exists unadded tags and the user tries to navigate away from the page. This is not the case where the user is submitting the changes in the page by clicking the "Save Changes" button, which seems to be what you are confused with.

In summary, the 3 cases are:

1. When there exists unadded tags, and the user tries to navigate away from the page by clicking a link on the page, not the "Save Changes" button. What message should we display?

2. When there exists unsaved changes, i.e. a new volume name, the user tries to navigate away from the page by clicking a link on the page, not the "Save Changes" button. What message should we display?

3. When there exists unsaved changes, i.e. a new volume name, or unsaved tags, the user tries to open up a dialog, which triggers the warning dialog. What message should we display? (notice that the user has no intention on navigate away in some dialog cases, such as attaching volume).

Hi [~kyolee]

If the user is opening a modal, they are leaving where they are and their changes will be lost, even if the detail page is displayed in the background. You can still use the same message for cases two and three. 

When there are unsaved subtasks within a page (cse 1), don't worry about that if they try to navigate away or initiate an action, just give them the unsaved changes text. If they then go back and click save changes, they should get the text to complete their subtask (add tags or whatever). 

If you need me, come find me in IRC.

Pull request has been updated to use a single warning message for all 3 cases:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/844

* dialog text repeats "are you sure you want to leave this page" in both paragraphs. It should only display once, in the second paragraph.
* confirm navigation modal when opening action menu items lacks buttons for stay and leave. 
* confirm navigation modal should not show requested modal first. We must fix this. Please consult with rest of dev team for ideas if you need help

The fix has been implemented on 3 detail pages for UX review: instance, scaling group and volume.

The warning modal for unsaved changes has been moved to appear prior to the action modal with the option to stay or leave.

The pull request is at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/844

Getting there, [~kyolee].

When the confirm nav dialog comes up before a modal box, the elements (as much as possible) should be the same as the other box that pops up. 
* The other box separates the dialog text into two paragraphs. Please do the same on the box that pops up before a modal box. 
* The button text on the box that pops up before a modal box should match the text on the other box, not just "stay" and "leave"

Also, the two buttons on the box that pops up before the modal box are too close together and aligned strangely. Please do the following, it will look better and highlight the recommended option better even if it's different than the other box:
* use the button-expand class on the stay button
* make the leave option a text link, centered below the stay button

The fix on the unsaved changes warning modal has been implemented. The new modal behavior has been applied to the other detail pages, including image, snapshot and security group pages.

Pull request at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/844

dialog looks great now, [~kyolee]! I pushed a change to correct some capitalization issues. 

Please complete this implementation by putting this on the user, group, account and role detail pages. 

Thanks

The unsaved changes warning modal and the navigate away detection have been added to the IAM user detail page and IAM group detail page. 

However, on IAM role detail page, there is no "Save Changes" option available for the role attributes; it'd be possible that the implementation is incomplete by David at the moment. In such case, the unsaved changes features will be added later once the IAM role detail page's edit capability is implemented on the 'develop' branch.

The new pull request is ready for UX review on the IAM user and IAM group detail pages:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/844
also accounts

Similar to IAM role page, the implementation of the IAM account detail page seems to be incomplete; the page is missing the save changes button , and appears to be unstable. For those 2 pages, the unsaved changes warning feature should be added later when the edit capability has been implemented, thoroughly tested, and merged to the 'develop' branch.

The UX review is ready for the IAM user and IAM group detail pages.
UX review passed. Needs code review, then ready to merge and move to QA..
Pull request 844 merged

This was working fine for me.  Verified, fixed.
